item.title: [hololive] Congratulations! Tokoyami Towa’s Second Album Release & 2nd Live Confirmed! Let’s Check Out the Details of These Two ...
Born From Co-Creation: Shishiro Hai and Unrivaled Loyalty
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: Sponsorship Born From Shared Sentiment – Building Excitement for Shishiro Hai TogetherShishiro Hai generates excitement that transcends location and dimension by involving both participants and fans alike and this would not be possible without collaborators lending Shishiro Botan a hand. Beyond mere sponsorship, it is a relationship that is not just strictly business but one between Shishiro Hai and each company who share a vision of building excitement for the event together and ensuring viewers are having the most fun possible. Introducing sponsors’ products and initiatives needs to be in a form that is entertaining taking into account viewer psychology and context in order for it to have a positive impression and be informative. Shishiro Botan and S both expressed the importance of such designs aimed at consumers for both the sponsors and for viewers. Here are some examples of initiatives that have featured during a Shishiro Hai:Gift and discount campaigns that are worthwhile for viewersProviding stories from even before the event starts to generate festival-like hypeSpecial segments that incorporate entertainment elements to keep viewers engagedPublic viewing locations to experience all the action of Shishiro Hai with others offlineCreative offerings from current vocational school studentsIn fact, through pre-tournament sponsor announcements and PR during the event, there has been no major drop-off in viewer numbers: rather, we have been able to maintain a festival-like atmosphere with continual comments being posted that mention company and brand names. Next, we will go into more detail about some of these initiatives.Event Initiatives and the Hype They GenerateVAXEE produced mousepads that featured key visuals from the 1st to the 3rd event, which were reposted about 19,000 times through follow and repost initiatives on X, and posts from appearing players and coaches delighted to receive mousepads of their own amassed a total of 853,000 impressions.With HP, the major sponsor of the 3rd Shishiro Hai, we had more correspondence on X from the announcement of their sponsorship right up until the event, including Shishiro Botan posting about her visit to HP headquarters, and also a “(Discount) Challenge Stream” that viewers could participate in, which kept fans engaged right up until the tournament started.There are also companies instantly recognizable by fans whose relationship with Shishiro Botan and hololive themselves also became a storyline: for example, Red Bull Japan, of which Shishiro herself is a virtual ambassador. When they were announced as a sponsor of the 1st tournament, we received comments such as “Thank you always” and “(The lion that gives me wings), and after the 3rd event, the convenience store chain Lawson held a campaign offering limited-edition stickers with Red Bull purchases across Japan.Shishiro Hai’s first special segment is now always a taste test stream in collaboration with a food/beverage company. Frozen meal delivery service provider nosh has collaborated for all three events, including Dietary Guidance with Shishiro (the 1st Shishiro Hai) and Telepathic Food Reviews! (the 2nd and 3rd events). The comment section was ecstatic to see appearances not normally witnessed, with about 160,000 viewers across all streams, including mirror streams, for the segment during the 1st tournament. Tournament participants also tried the “あえて、®” () range of frozen meals from Ajinomoto, who have recently expanded into the esports industry. For a tournament that can be full of tension at times, these are the perfect segments to unwind and have a good time.Public viewings held at esports Challenger’s Park (QTnet) for the 2nd edition of the tournament, and HUB for the 3rd event, with a limited-time drinks selection and bonus coasters available at HUB, gave fans a space to not only watch the tournament unfold live, but also hang out before and after the events.Students from the Tokyo Design Technology Center have produced a range of assets and material used for Shishiro Hai including subtitles for participants and interviews, as well as slides shown on stream during the tournament. As well as it being rare and novel for a school to collaborate for a VTuber event as a sponsor, it garnered positive reactions from those in awe of the creative skills current school students have.How Much Students Gained From Shishiro Hai: Tokyo Design Technology Center――Tell us about what led to starting this initiative with Shishiro Hai, anything in particular that has left an impression and any challenges that have been taken on through this collaboration.What led to working with Shishiro Hai was the visit from hololive talents as guests to our campus open day. We saw the incredible response and interest from high schoolers and students currently attending our school, and strongly felt that collaborations with VTubers can be rather effective for the younger generation in providing new learnings for our students and generating PR for our school.What particularly left an impression was how flexibly sponsorship conditions, which were originally meant for businesses, were changed to suit a school like us. This was never just purely a sponsorship arrangement but was structured so that we could be involved with the production of actual material as a practical learning experience for the students who could see the meaning of a school being a sponsor and get true educational value out of the experience. There are also not many cases of a school being a sponsor so it was a truly meaningful experience and one we are grateful to have been a part of.――What learnings, opportunities, and skills have students gained from being involved with an event like Shishiro Hai? Tell us about the response from students and any instances that left an impression.There were so many things students gained from being involved with Shishiro Hai. One of the major things was being able to experience an actual production workflow and the technical level required in the workplace through this project. This is different to other schoolwork in the fact that students were able to develop a real sense of responsibility that their work will actually be used and learnt more practical skills.In particular, students gave a lot of positive feedback from working in an environment directly related to an industry that they are aiming to get into, saying that they had a clearer picture of what career path they want to take, which was a huge motivation for them.▼Creative works that students produced(In the red box)――What was the response from viewers and users like? In particular, were there any comments on X or livestream in response to the students’ work that really stood out?We received a lot of kind comments and support in response to students’ work that was actually displayed on stream, which have been a huge source of encouragement for both students and faculty members. The more times we do it as well, we have started to see comments that really feel like viewers are acknowledging our continual efforts, which is really pleasing to see.There have also been comments like, “I didn’t know that sponsors could also be educational facilities,” with interest coming from not only viewers but companies in other industries as well. We have recently had more inquiries about other projects connected to student learning and development, and we can receive more meaningful project proposals now that there is more of a prior understanding about the educational goals and intentions that we have.――What do you think about the future potential of educational programs linked with actual entertainment content like Shishiro Hai? What do you as a school expect from or what challenge would you like to take on with respect to Shishiro Hai or similar projects?We feel like the learning potential for educational programs in conjunction with actual entertainment content like Shishiro Hai will really expand. Experiences where you can receive direct feedback from industry professionals and viewers are extremely practical for students and can increase their understanding of what is to come in the future. Through these kinds of initiatives, we hope that it can develop into a system where students can forge a career path in the industry.Also, in addition to submissions of design production works, we hope that there are more opportunities to provide similar practical experiences from a project, management and data analysis perspective and we would like to independently create more as well.「A Unique Growth in Loyalty: Shishiro Hai from the Perspective of Shuhei Matsumoto, Producer of Street Fighter 6.―― What expectations do you have as a publisher after collaborating on VTuber Shishiro Botan’s event Shishiro Hai?There have already been 3 reiterations of Shishiro Hai, but I always feel there is a willingness to try and keep growing the event with the changes made each time. It is evident that this attitude is one of the big reasons that the more times the event is held, the more loyalty from viewers and participants increases. We are extremely grateful that such growth in loyalty has had a positive effect on Street Fighter 6.Shishiro Hai is an esports event with a slightly different atmosphere to the more “serious” tournaments that we host such as CAPCOM Pro Tour and STREET FIGHTER LEAGUE. I always think that esports can take any form and wonder what Shishiro Hai has in store for us each time.。――How have you dealt with the ripple effect and response that has come from co-creation projects with Shishiro Botan such as Shishiro Hai?Shishiro Botan has hosted other events featuring Street Fighter 6 besides Shishiro Hai, and each one has been accepted by the fighting game community. As you just mentioned, there has been a huge ripple effect on Street Fighter 6, with a remarkable amount of comments from people who have seen Shishiro’s events and wanted to give the game a go. This effect has led to us proposing a collaboration for the release of the AI character generated from data collected from Shishiro Botan gameplay. This allows players to be able to play against Shishiro, and the already high levels of user loyalty for her have led to an amazing amount of player engagement. ――How does CAPCOM, one of the leading fighting game developers for many years now, feel about the potential and value of entertainment such as esports tournaments and gaming streams hosted by VTubers?There is so much potential and huge value in these sorts of events. This is just my personal view, but VTubers continuing to enjoy playing our games only increases their value. Fans want to see their favorite VTuber, or their , having fun playing video games and if they like it and continuing playing so much that they end up hosting gaming events, then they will want to support even more. The intentions behind the concept and game modes of Street Fighter 6 are already well-known, and by having VTubers also understand this will contribute to the lasting success of such events rather than them just being a passing trend and make it easier for VTubers to pitch new project ideas. This is when it turns from a mere collaboration into co-creation together with VTubers which I feel holds real value in unlocking new potential for the game. What did you think about this three-part special feature on the appeal of and behind the scenes of Shishiro Hai? We have tried to take you behind the scenes at how the event was born and the potential it has created in terms of both business and entertainment.This tournament, which started from Shishiro Botan’s passion for Street Fighter, has led to the creation of a new form of entertainment that pushes the boundaries of esports events through co-creation with many businesses, talents, creators, and, of course, fans.We will be bringing you more content on COVER projects and behind-the-scenes looks at other examples of co-creation and the value they bring here on COVERedge, so please stay tuned.©CAPCOM* All company names, product names, and service names mentioned on this page are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective companies.

item.title: Japan Post suspends shipments to the U.S. starting August 27th
item.author: Joanna Kochanowska
item.content:encoded: We want to inform you about an important change affecting shipments to the United States via Japan Post.On , the U.S. government issued an executive order, “Termination of De Minimis Treatment for All Countries,” eliminating duty-free treatment for certain imports. Starting , goods imported for personal use will be subject to tariffs and additional customs requirements.Due to these changes and unclear customs procedures, Japan Post will temporarily suspend the acceptance of the following items for shipment to the United States beginning August 27, 2025:Individual gifts with a content value exceeding USD 100Goods intended for sale or consumptionBecause Blackship ships from a company to individuals, Japan Post services will no longer be available for most shipments to the United States until further notice.However, printed materials such as books and magazines can still be shipped via Japan Post. At the moment, Printed Matter Airmail is the only Japan Post shipping option available for shipments to the U.S. through Blackship.Alternative Shipping OptionsShipments to the U.S. can still be sent using our international courier partners: FedEx and DHL. These carriers remain fully operational and are unaffected by the Japan Post suspension.You can find the original Japan Post announcement here. You can find more information about the Changes to U.S. Duty Exemptions here.Thank you for your continued support. We will keep you informed as the situation evolves and share any further updates from Japan Post as they become available.

New US-Japan Trade Deal + Changes to U.S. Duty Exemptions
item.author: Joanna Kochanowska
item.content:encoded: We wanted to share two important updates that may impact your future proxy orders from Japan.US-Japan Trade Deal HighlightsThe US and Japan have just signed a major new trade agreement. Here’s what it could mean for your shopping:15% Tariffs on Japanese Goods: U.S. importers (both individuals and businesses) will be required to pay a 15% tariff on Japanese products, which will increase the total amount you have to pay.Price Fluctuations are Possible: Japanese markets are rising, a sign that brand pricing may adjust in response to trade changes.You can still shop from Japan as usual. We’re monitoring developments and will let you know if anything changes.DHL Japan: Upcoming Change to U.S. Duty-Free ExemptionsDHL Japan has informed us of a major update from the U.S. government that could impact how customs duties are applied to your orders:Effective August 29 at 12:01 a.m. EDT, all shipments to the US, regardless of origin, will no longer qualify for De minimis (duty-free) treatment. will now be subject to all applicable U.S. duties, including general tariffs and those under special trade laws.Informal entry (for shipments under USD $2,500) may still apply, but this is not yet confirmed. The following will still be duty-free:Gifts under USD $100 sent from an individual overseas to a U.S. individual.Personal belongings/household goods valued under brought in by travelers.We’ll keep you posted as more details emerge.Thank you for your continued trust in Blackship. We value your business and are working diligently to navigate these changes together.

Delivering Experiences – An Interview with COVER’s Deputy Head of Production Planning on Enriching Oshi Culture
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: When I think about production planning, I often look to Dr. Clayton Christensen’s “Jobs To Be Done” theory. The idea is that when people buy something, they’re not just seeking the product’s function itself, but something beyond that. A well-known example is the milkshake. People don’t necessarily order a milkshake simply because they’re thirsty. They might buy it to make a long drive less boring, or because they want to be seen as a kind parent who treats their children. In other words, there’s ultimately a state or experience they want to achieve through a particular product – in this case, the milkshake.When we apply this way of thinking to our merchandise, the same holds true. Take acrylic stands, for example. Fans aren’t simply buying them for the sake of owning one – they’re looking for the experiences and value that come after. The same goes for can badges. It’s not just about having the badge itself, but about creating an to show their , posting photos on X and getting likes, or even sparking conversations with new fellow fans. In that sense, the true goal of merchandise is not the item itself, but the experiences and relationships it helps to create. Fans of hololive have a culture of connecting with one another – coming together to cheer on their favorite talents. At events, for example, it’s common to see fans reaching out to each other, gathering and taking photos together. In those moments, merchandise serves as a tool that helps fans connect, which is why, in the end, I see the role of merchandise as providing an experience. It’s not simply about offering merchandise, but about creating moments – feeling closer to your , or sharing a sense of community with fellow fans. Through merchandise, we want to deliver that kind of experiential value.

item.content:encoded: August 17, 2025, Tokyo, JAPAN – COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Tanigo Motoaki) announces the first-ever concert featuring all hololive Indonesia talents, themed around a “colorful future,” aptly titled hololive Indonesia 5th Anniversary LIVE Chromatic Future, to be held on Saturday, November 15, 2025, in Indonesia. This event will serve as the main highlight of hololive Indonesia’s 5th anniversary celebrations, which have been ongoing since April this year.For the first time, all nine hololive Indonesia talents from three generations; Ayunda Risu, Moona Hoshinova, Airani Iofifteen, Kureiji Ollie, Anya Melfissa, Pavolia Reine, Vestia Zeta, Kaela Kovalskia, and Kobo Kanaeru will share the stage in an offline music concert held at Indonesia’s event for creators, Comic Frontier 21, located at ICE BSD Hall 6, South Tangerang.”I’m thrilled that the hololive Indonesia concert is finally becoming a reality. We’re working hard to make sure our fans in Indonesia will enjoy it, so please look forward to it!” commented Motoaki Tanigo, CEO, COVER Corporation.The concert will utilize Unreal Engine technology for the first time in a hololive Indonesia performance, offering fans a uniquely enhanced concert experience. This historic event is proudly sponsored by Pocky and KARAOKE MANEKINEKO.For the latest updates on the event, ticketing information, and merchandise, visit the official hololive Indonesia 5th Anniversary LIVE Chromatic Future website and follow the official hololive Indonesia social media channels. More exciting announcements are on the way, so don’t miss out!hololive Indonesia 5th Anniversary LIVE Chromatic Future: Overviewhololive Indonesia 5th Anniversary LIVE Chromatic Future Organized by: COVER Corporation / hololive production #holoIDChromaticFuture November 15, 2025, 19:00 (WIB) COMIC FRONTIER 21 Jl. Inside the VTuber industry, according to a COVER exec - Mashable
Achieving Creators’ Dreams and Creating a Challenge-Oriented Organization: An Interview with the Head of the Administration Department
item.author: 平松梨沙
item.content:encoded: In recent years within the entertainment industry, anime in particular has seen a significant increase in the demand for proper compliance. This isn’t just demanded of us as a publicly listed company, but as the result of a structural shift within the industry as a whole. In fact, the anime market has grown two-fold over the last 10 years to be currently worth over 3 trillion yen, and of this, 1.6 trillion yen is in the Japanese market alone. It is now to the point where anime has lost the ‘Cool Japan’ tag and is now considered to be a major industry on the global stage. However, for a while there, admittedly, our creators were handling excessive workloads, but a report from the United Nations Commission of Inquiry in October 2023 shedding light on labor conditions within the anime industry has garnered international attention on the issue (with discussions reaching the point of whether or not to release details on Netflix, etc.) causing the industry to rethink and apply global standards to traditional working methods that have propped up the anime industry up until now. We are fully aware of these issues having received our own recommendations with regards to the Subcontractor Act in Japan. For our hard-working creators, we need to adopt measures that may be seen as rather strict regulations at times, but this is a necessary path we have to take for the betterment of the industry as a whole.To address this, we are implementing measures such as improvements to workflows and eliminating excessive working hours by working with the Corporate Planning Office in particular to come up with fundamental ways to resolve such structural issues. We also feel like we are coming together as an industry through collaborations with other companies in the industry and media mix projects.As a company at the forefront of the industry, here at COVER we are not content with just simply addressing compliance issues, but rather proactively providing information and making efforts to ensure the steady development of the industry as a whole. This is absolutely necessary to continue to develop Japanese anime and VTubing as an entertainment industry we can be proud of, which includes improving our efforts in ensuring that talents and creators can thrive under sustainable working conditions.

item.title: Ninomae Ina'nis and SUSHIRO HONG KONG Team Up for the First-Ever hololive English Collaboration Starting August 13! - Hololive
Ninomae Ina'nis and SUSHIRO HONG KONG Team Up for the First-Ever hololive English Collaboration Starting August 13! | NEWS - ホロライブ公式サイト
Ninomae Ina’nis and SUSHIRO HONG KONG Team Up for the First-Ever hololive English Collaboration Starting August 13!
item.author: os_pr
item.content:encoded: August 13, 2025, Tokyo, JAPAN – COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Tanigo Motoaki) has announced that hololive English -Myth- talent Ninomae Ina’nis will be teaming up with SUSHIRO HONG KONG for the first-ever hololive English collaboration. A series of themed stores, limited-time collaboration menu items, and exclusive merchandise will start on Wednesday, August 13th, 2025 and end on Sunday, September 14, 2025.Ninomae Ina’nis was at SOGO Causeway Bay! Earlier this month, Ninomae Ina’nis made a surprise appearance on SOGO Causeway Bay’s LED TV Screen, creating buzz among local fans and officially kicking off this highly anticipated collaboration.SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis collaboration starts from August 13th! Ninomae Ina’nis will be taking over SUSHIRO HONG KONG with a special themed collaboration from August 13th until September 14, 2025.During the promotion period, all SUSHIRO HONG KONG locations will offer three collaboration menu items and a special takeaway sushi set, each accompanied by limited-edition merchandise. In addition, customers who dine-in or use takeaway self-pickup services and spend a designated amount will be eligible to purchase exclusive collaboration goods — a must-have for any fan!WAH! Three Themed Stores Pop Up Across Hong Kong – Calling All Fans to Show Up and Snap Away!Starting August 13, three exclusive themed stores will open in Mong Kok, Causeway Bay Plaza 2, and Yuen Long Plaza. The special collaboration introduces two exclusive key visuals of Ninomae Ina’nis under the concept of “Day and Night”: By day, she takes on the cheerful role of a SUSHIRO staff member, and by night, she returns to her mystical roots as the Ancient Priestess.Each store is fully themed with large photo walls, life-size standees, and custom table decorations—creating the perfect space for fans to snap photos, show their support, and enjoy exclusive collaboration menu items available only for a limited time.Date: August 13 – September 14, 2025・ SUSHIRO Mong Kok Address: B/F, King Wah Centre, 628 Nathan Road, Mong Kok, Kowloon・ SUSHIRO Causeway Bay Plaza 2 Address: Shop 3A, 3/F, Causeway Bay Plaza 2, 463–483 Lockhart Road, Causeway Bay・ SUSHIRO Yuen Long Plaza Address: Shops 341–348, 3/F, Yuen Long Plaza, 249–251 Castle Peak Road, Yuen Long, New TerritoriesSUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Exclusive Collaboration Merchandise DetailsThis summer, SUSHIRO HONG KONG and Ninomae Ina’nis bring fans a flavorful trio of themed dishes. Each dine-in order of a collaboration item comes with one piece of exclusive merchandise — a double dose of surprise and delight! Items feature chibi Ina’nis in original designs created just for this event, paired with SUSHIRO’s most popular menu icons and mascots![SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Food Pick with Purchase]Event Period: August 13 – September 14, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Customers who dine-in at any SUSHIRO location in Hong Kong and order “Ina’nis’ Favorite! Seared Mentaiko Trio (HK$22)”, will receive one randomly selected per eligible order.・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis food pick*6 designs in total, randomly distributed; limited to one per transaction.[SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Acrylic Mini Standee with Purchase]Event Period: August 13 – September 14, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Customers who dine-in at any SUSHIRO location in Hong Kong and order “Takodachi Energy Boost: Fried Octopus Bites (HK$36)”, will receive one randomly selected per eligible order.・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis acrylic mini standee*6 designs in total, randomly distributed; limited to one per transaction.[SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Acrylic Transparent Card Keychain with Purchase]Event Period: August 13 – September 14, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Customers who dine-in at any SUSHIRO location in Hong Kong and order “WAH! Eldritch Trial: Red Grape Parfait (HK$38)”, will receive one randomly selected acrylic transparent card keychain per eligible order.・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis acrylic transparent card keychain*6 designs in total, randomly distributed; limited to one per transaction.SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Exclusive Takeaway MerchandiseIn addition to the dine-in exclusive items, Sushiro has specially launched the “Ina’nis Collab Takeaway Sushi Set”, a convenient option for busy Hong Kongers on the go.[SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Takeaway Sushi Set – Exclusive Merchandise Promotion]Event Period: August 13 – September 14, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Customers who purchase the “Ina’nis Collab Takeaway Sushi Set” (HK$99) at any SUSHIRO HONG KONG location will receive one SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Eco-Bag per set purchased.・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Eco-Bag*1 design in total; limited to one per transaction.The eco-bag features both day and night versions of Ina’nis on the front, elegant collaboration branding on the back, and an attached Takodachi-shaped pouch for convenient storage.SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Add-On Merchandise PromotionSUSHIRO HONG KONG is launching four exclusive collaboration merchandise items for local fans. During the promotion period, customers who dine in or use takeaway self-pickup and spend a net amount of HK$200* or more in a single transaction will be eligible to purchase select items at a special add-on price*. Each item is available while supplies last and offers the perfect way to commemorate this limited-time collaboration!*Net amount refers to the final payment after deducting discounts, coupons, or promotions and includes the 10% service charge. *Not applicable to orders via third-party delivery platforms.[SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Add-On Merchandise – Phase 1]Event Period: Starting from August 13, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Spend HK$200 or more at any SUSHIRO HONG KONG location, dine-in or takeaway self-pickup only, to become eligible to purchase the following items:・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Acrylic Carabiner Keychain – HK$49*2 designs in total, randomly distributed; limited to one per transaction.・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Cooling Fan – HK$169*2 designs in total, randomly distributed; limited to one per transaction.[SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Add-On Merchandise – Phase 2]Event Period: Starting from August 27, 2025, while supplies last. Event Rules: Spend HK$200 or more at any SUSHIRO HONG KONG location, dine-in or takeaway self-pickup only, to become eligible to purchase the following items:・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Magnetic Plush Charms – HK$219*1 set includes 2 designs・ SUSHIRO HONG KONG x Ninomae Ina’nis Acrylic Standee – HK$149*2 designs in total, customers may choose a design. For information regarding the event, please visit SUSHIRO HONG KONG’s official social media channels:Founded in 1984, Sushiro has grown to become Japan’s No.1 conveyor belt sushi brand. As of the end of March 2024, the brand operates 797 locations across Japan and overseas (including takeaway-only stores). In Hong Kong, there are currently 35 branches, each offering over 100 types of sushi and Japanese dishes at any given time. As a leader in Japan’s conveyor belt sushi market, Sushiro is committed to a customer-first philosophy — carefully selecting ingredients, continuously developing new flavors, and leveraging cutting-edge technology to enhance service quality. The brand strives to deliver high-quality and great-value Japanese cuisine to all customers.

Cover Corp Q1 2025: Revenue Growth Insights
item.author: Thomas Toblu
item.content:encoded: Figure — Revenue trend (FY totals and latest Q1).Cover’s Q1 (three months ended June 30, 2025) is a clearest-possible example of a business shifting from product-market proof into active scale mode. The quarter delivered a large top-line jump driven by one particularly successful product line, while the company also pushed hard on infrastructure, technology and overseas expansion. That combination produced solid absolute profits but compressed margins compared with the company’s best historical quarters.Below is a full read of the quarter: the numbers, what caused them, how Cover is allocating capital, the tensions and risks this creates, and the structural strengths that make this a meaningful pivot rather than a one-off spike.Cash & Cash Equivalents (end Q1)(Values and percent changes from Cover Corp Q1 presentation.)Where the growth came fromThe dominant story for the quarter is merchandising — specifically, the launch and rapid scale of the hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME (TCG). Merchandising accounted for roughly of Q1 revenue (about ¥5.84B of ¥9.63B). The TCG moved Cover from a diversified-revenue mix into a quarter where a single product family was the largest contributor.Figure — Q1 revenue mix: merchandising was roughly 60% of sales this quarter.Why the TCG matters: it combines recognizable IP, repeat purchase cycles (new sets, booster releases), event-driven demand (tournaments and league play) and collectible economics. Those characteristics make it high-leverage for an IP-first company: strong unit economics on physical product, recurring drop cycles, and community-driven engagement that feeds back into virtual events and content.That concentration is important — it produced the big topline move, but it also creates a single-point dependency for quarterly performance.Profits, margins and the investment trade-offCover delivered higher absolute profits (operating profit ¥972M, net profit ¥693M), but margins show the impact of active reinvestment.Figure — Gross, operating and net margins for the quarter (rounded).: strong. The merchandising-heavy mix, where merchandise typically carries healthier gross margins than pure streaming revenue, lifted gross profitability.: positive but compressed relative to periods without heavy upfront investment. The company reports increasing R&D, logistics consolidation and overseas setup costs that absorb a portion of the gross uplift.: likewise positive but indicates a significant share of revenue is consumed by the non-operating items and tax/interest compared with gross profit.Put simply: revenue growth translated into higher gross profit, but Cover deliberately reallocated a chunk of that cash into investments intended to expand future capacity and quality — which lowered the percent of revenue that flowed through to operating profit this quarter.Where Cover is spending — the “build” phaseCover describes its current actions as foundational: spending now for capabilities that should help scale the business and diversify revenue later. The main categories of investment called out in the quarter:Expressive technology & R&D — more advanced 3D/live concert tooling, motion capture workflows, and production technology that enable richer, more interactive shows and collaboration with external partners.Logistics and supply chain — a consolidated logistics center began full operation on , intended to shorten delivery times and reduce per-order handling costs as volumes grow.Overseas expansion & local channels — building localized EC presence and licensing relationships in North America and other regions to reduce cross-border friction and capture more local demand.Content and event production capacity — more concerts, larger productions, and supplemental studio/staff investment to raise product quality and live-event scale.Management also presented a medium-term investment plan that contemplates roughly of cumulative growth investments (including M&A) through FY2030, paired with an ambition to reach ~¥100 billion in revenue and ¥25 billion in operating profit by that horizon. Those numbers frame the current investments as strategic and multi-year rather than simply tactical.Balance sheet — runway exists, for nowCover finished Q1 with about in cash and equivalents. The company is profitable in absolute terms and holds a meaningful cash cushion. That balance sheet provides runway to fund the medium-term build-out and to absorb some execution hiccups — but it does not eliminate the need for measured returns on the substantial planned investments.Because the company intends large, multi-year capital and M&A commitments, the health of the balance sheet will depend on the pace at which investment converts into recurring revenue and margin expansion.Risks and friction points made explicit in the reportSeveral concrete risks are visible in the Q1 materials:Concentration risk (TCG dependency): merchandising’s outsized contribution (nearly +100% YoY growth) is heavily tied to the TCG. If demand softens, or if competitors or product fatigue reduce momentum, merchandising could normalize sharply.Trade policy and tariffs: management noted a tariff-driven hit to North American e-commerce that temporarily cut monthly sales from that region to roughly half prior-year levels at one stage. International trade policy is an external variable that affected EC performance and pushes the company to localize sales channels.Rising fixed costs and execution risk: new logistics, studios, staff and technology create a higher fixed cost base. If revenue growth doesn’t keep pace or new products take longer to mature, margins could be pressured. retirements reduced membership/streaming revenue in the quarter. A business rooted in performers will always carry talent risk — retirements, image issues, or turnover can materially affect engagement and related revenue.These are not hypothetical risks; they are the issues the company called out and positioned as active items to manage.Strengths and structural positivesAlongside these risks there are structural positives worth noting:Proven product-market fit for a physical IP product. The TCG demonstrated tangible ability to convert virtual talent and fandom into a mainstream hobby product, with tournament and community play amplifying demand.Licensing & partner momentum. The company is expanding licensing relationships and working to monetize IP across platforms and territories — a natural path for an IP-first company that can linearize its fanbase into multiple product categories.Operational upgrades that compound. The logistics center and supply-chain consolidation can reduce marginal shipping costs and delivery headaches as volume increases; technology investments (Holoearth and expressive tech) can yield differentiated experiences that are harder to replicate.Positive absolute profitability and cash buffers. Cover is not burning cash this quarter; it is generating operating profit while building. That gives management flexibility to absorb execution variance and pursue strategic expansion.Looking forward — what the next few quarters will revealThis quarter is the start of a new phase: the charts and numbers show a business that converted IP into a high-volume merchandising product and then immediately reinvested that success into infrastructure and product expansion. The next few quarters will be the test:Is merchandising strength repeatable beyond the immediate launch windows of the TCG?Does localization and supply-chain work blunt the tariff impacts and restore more stable overseas growth?Will the investment program start to generate margin expansion, or will the fixed-cost base outpace revenue increases?Answers to those questions will determine whether Q1 is the opening chapter of durable scale or a high-water mark that requires careful management to sustain.Cover’s Q1 is a mixture of a clear success and deliberate risk-taking. The company turned a major IP product into a dominant, high-margin revenue source for the quarter and used that momentum to finance infrastructure and capability-building. That approach has solid rationale: merchandising and events coupled with improved logistics and expressive tech can turn transient product spikes into sustainable revenue platforms. But it also creates execution dependencies — concentration around a single product line, external policy exposures, and a heavier fixed-cost base.Numbers this quarter are real and meaningful: strong revenue growth, improved gross profit, positive operating profit and a healthy cash position. The key question is whether the investments now under way will diversify and stabilize revenue while improving long-term margins — or whether the company will need to adjust if merchandising cools and the new fixed costs remain high. The Q1 slides make both the upside and the risks explicit; the next few quarterly reports will tell which direction the company’s execution takes.Cover Corp FY2026/3 Q1 presentation (financial results for the three months ended June 30, 2025) — numbers and program descriptions are taken from the company’s Q1 materials. embedded charts created from the Q1 figures (revenue trend, Q1 revenue mix, margin breakdown; headline table shows key metrics).

RHINOSHIELD Launches Exclusive Collaboration with hololive production — Limited-Time VTuber Phone Accessories Now Available for Preorder
item.author: os_pr
item.content:encoded: Global mobile accessories brand today announced the launch of its biggest summer collaboration yet — the “VTuber Summer Fest 2025” — in partnership with four popular talents from , offering fans a series of officially licensed phone cases, lifestyle accessories, and exclusive gifts. Available for a limited time from , the collection will be sold across Taiwan, Japan, Europe, North America, and other key markets.An Officially Licensed Dream Collaboration with Four hololive production talentsThe “VTuber Summer Fest” brings together a cross-generation lineup of hololive talents. Returning collaborator is joined by first-time partners , , and . Together, they star in over 12 limited-edition summer-themed designs inspired by swimwear, yukata, and mascot motifs.Products include RHINOSHIELD’s signature Impact-Resistant Phone Cases and the fan-favorite AquaStand MagSafe Water Bottles.Impact-Resistant Phone Cases ・ Designs： 4 designs per talent ・ Supported Models： AirX, SolidX, SolidSuit, Clear, JellyTint, Mod NX ・ Compatible with a wide range of iPhone and Android models ・ Variants： Standard / MagSafe Compatible ・ Price： From (Standard) / (MagSafe)AquaStand MagSafe Water Bottles ・ Designs： 3 designs per talent ・ Bottle Types： Stainless Steel (L) 700ml / Tritan (L) 800ml / Stainless Steel (M) 480ml ・ Price： From Limited-Time Preorder Bonus PeriodsShishiro Botan： July 25, 06:00 AM – August 27, 10:00 AM (EDT) Momosuzu Nene： August 1, 05:00 AM – August 27, 10:00 PM (EDT) Mori Calliope & Ninomae Ina’nis： August 8, 00:00 AM – August 27, 10:00 PM (EDT)All items are available for preorder only. Shipping times may vary by product and will follow the order in which purchases are made.Exclusive Tiered Preorder Gifts Spend on a single talent’s collection before , and receive (3 designs total, randomly shipped, no selection allowed). Spend on a single talent’s collection before , and receive the full set of 3 acrylic stands, plus an and limited-edition collectible card.* The tote bag and card are limited-quantity bonuses available while supplies last. Acrylic stands are time-limited bonuses and will be granted to qualifying purchases made before 5:00 AM (EDT) on August 27, 2025. * Purchases for each talent are counted separately. Spending across different talent lines cannot be combined. In case of returns, all gifts must also be returned.Orders over qualify for free shipping.Discount codes cannot be applied to orders containing talent collaboration items.Purchase both a phone case and an AquaStand bottle from the talent collection to enjoy up to 30% off the bottle.

item.title: hololive production and RHINOSHIELD are expanding their collaboration with the new “holonatsu Paradise” collection, starting August 8!
item.author: os_pr
item.content:encoded: August 8, 2025, Tokyo, JAPAN – COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Tanigo Motoaki) has announced that hololive production will be expanding its collaboration with RHINOSHIELD to include eight additional talents. The “holonatsu Paradise” collection will feature seasonal designs and limited-time gifts. Sales will begin on August 8th and run until August 27th, 2025.Quantities are limited — be sure to order early to support your oshi in style!RHINOSHIELD x hololive production “holonatsu Paradise” collection is here!The new summer collection features eight talents from hololive Gen 0 and hololive English -Promise-, bringing a burst of energy to the summer season. The collaboration introduces all-new, officially licensed summer-themed phone accessory designs — each one crafted to celebrate the unique charm of every talent. To supercharge your summer, fans can unlock special preorder perks available for a limited time only. Whether you’re cheering for your oshi or collecting them all, this is the ultimate summer drop no hololive fan should miss.hololive Gen 0 and hololive English -Promise- Assemble for an Unforgettable Summer!The RHINOSHIELD x hololive production “holonatsu Paradise” collection features eight talents: ・ hololive Gen 0: Tokino Sora, Robocosan, AZKi, Sakura Miko, Hoshimachi Suisei ・ hololive English -Promise-: IRyS, Ouro Kronii, Hakos BaelzEach talent will appear in exclusive summer-inspired designs across multiple RHINOSHIELD product categories, including impact-resistant phone cases, AquaStand MagSafe water bottles, AirPods cases, and GRIP O phone grips. Every design blends character details with seasonal flair, delivering accessories that are stylish, collectible, and functional — all officially licensed and compatible with a wide range of iPhone and Android devices, including MagSafe.“holonatsu Paradise” collection LineupImpact-Resistant Phone Cases ・ 2 designs per talent ・ Supported Models: AirX, SolidX, SolidSuit, Clear, JellyTint, Mod NX ・ iPhone and Android compatible (full list on website) ・ Variants: Standard / MagSafe Compatible ・ Price: From $39.99 (Standard) / $52.99 (MagSafe)AquaStand MagSafe Water Bottles ・ 1 design per talent ・ Bottle Types: Stainless Steel (L) 700ml / Tritan (L) 800ml / Stainless Steel (M) 480ml ・ Price: From $49.99 ・ 1 design per talent ・ 1 design per talentExclusive Tiered Preorder Bonus GiftEvent Period: August 8th to August 27th, 2025, 5:00 AM (EDT)Event Rules: Spend $60 on any single talent’s collection before the deadline to receive a limited-edition screen cleaning cloth featuring that talent.Bonus Gift: One RHINOSHIELD x hololive production screen cleaning cloth.*1 design per talent; limited to one cloth per qualifying transaction.Event Period: August 8th to August 27th, 2025, 5:00 AM (EDT)Event Rules: Spend $119 on any single talent’s collection before the deadline to receive both the screen cleaning cloth and an exclusive frameless collectible art print.Bonus Gift: One RHINOSHIELD x hololive production screen cleaning cloth and one RHINOSHIELD x hololive production frameless collectible art print.*1 design per talent for each item; limited to one bonus set per qualifying transaction.[Bonus Terms & Conditions]Bonus items are available while supplies last. Purchases for each talent are tracked separately — totals cannot be combined across different talents. If a qualifying order is returned, all bonus items must also be returned.Purchase Bonus Campaign & Bundle Discounts DetailsCampaign Period: August 8th to August 27th, 2025, 5:00 AM (EDT) Free Shipping: Available for orders over $50 Discount Codes: Not applicable to orders containing talent collaboration items Buy one talent’s phone case + AquaStand to receive up to 30% off the AquaStand Buy one talent’s phone case + GRIP O to receive 5% off the GRIP O

AZKi × Maaya Uchida Collaborative Song “Sekai no Iro” Released Digitally on Thursday, August 7!
item.author: narita
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Motoaki Tanigo) has announced the digital release of “Sekai no Iro,” the theme song for the animated promotional video of the virtual world project Holoearth, which became available at midnight (JST) on Thursday, August 7, 2025.■ HOLOEARTH animated PV “Now, discover your other world.”This promotional video, produced by WIT STUDIO, embodies the concept for the world that Holoearth aspires to create. The featured theme song, titled “Sekai no Iro” (Colors of the World), is performed in collaboration between AZKi and Maaya Uchida. In addition to the rich harmony woven by these two artists, this release also includes solo versions for a 4-track collection. Title： Sekai no Iro Artists： AZKi, Maaya Uchida Lyrics： Haruka Kato Composition： Haruka Kato, Nozomi Tanabe Arrangement： Nozomi Tanabe■ Track list 1.Sekai no Iro 2.Sekai no Iro (AZKi solo ver.) 3.Sekai no Iro (Maaya Uchida solo ver.) 4.Sekai no Iro (Instrumental)■ Sales format Digital distribution■ Date of availability August 7, 2025 (Thu)

item.title: hololive production Returns to Anime NYC 2025! - ホロライブ公式サイト
hololive production Returns to Anime NYC 2025!
item.author: narita
item.content:encoded: Tokyo, JAPAN — COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo, Japan, CEO: Motoaki Tanigo) announced today that hololive production will be at Anime NYC 2025 from August 21st – 24th at Javits Convention Center in New York City.hololive production booth at Anime NYC 2025 Overview August 21st- 24th, 2025 Javits Convention Center 445 11th Ave, New York, NY 10001hololive production booth Streaming Activities hololive productions talents are back at Anime NYC! Visit our booth (#1710) and enjoy convention-exclusive live interactions together with our talents from hololive, hololive Indonesia, hololive English, hololive DEV_IS, and HOLOSTARS English. The list of participating talents will be announced through social media at a later time. Guests at Anime NYC will get the chance to sing in front of their oshis! As a feature program for the booth streaming activities, convention guests may perform hololive production songs to a judging panel of three discerning talents, who will give them a score based on whatever wild, fun metrics they may decide.hololive production Stamp Rally Stamp cards will be distributed at the booth, and attendees can collect stamps by visiting the booths of our hololive Meet partner companies. Depending on the amount of stamps collected, participants who collect stamps on their card may be eligible to receive prizes!Special Gifts and Freebies ・ Memorial Stamp ・ hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME English Edition Exclusive PR Card with hololive STAGE World Tour ‘25 -Synchronize!- Key Visual ・ hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME CatalogOur time schedule and other booth program details will be announced at a later date. Please check our official X account for the latest information!https://x.com/hololive_EnCome see, experience, and enjoy hololive production talents at the hololive production booth at Anime NYC 2025!
